00022 #ifndef _CANARYPRIOR_H
00023 #define _CANARYPRIOR_H
00024 
00025 //
00026 #include <cstring>
00027 #include <string>
00028 #include <valarray>
00029 //
00030 
00031 class CanaryPrior {
00032 
00033 public:
00034   // Check the default constructors to see if the empty fields might be
00035   // filled in other than empty.  Otherwise let the compiler do it.
00036   CanaryPrior() { }
00037 
00038 
00039   CanaryPrior(std::string region, std::valarray<double> props,
00040       std::valarray<double> means, std::valarray<double> vars);
00041 
00042 
00043   // Copy constructor just to make sure that references to vector<T> 
00044   // are not held.  Want actual copies to be safe.
00045   CanaryPrior(const CanaryPrior & CP);
00046 
00047   // Assignment 
00048   CanaryPrior & operator=(const CanaryPrior & CP);
00049 
00050   std::string region() { return _region; }
00051   std::valarray<double>prop() { return  _prop; }
00052   double prop(int k) { return  _prop[k]; }
00053 
00054   std::valarray<double>mean() { return  _mean; }
00055   double mean(int k) { return  _mean[k]; }
00056 
00057   std::valarray<double>var() { return _var; }
00058   double var(int k) { return  _var[k]; }
00059   void var(std::valarray<double>var_in) { _var = var_in; }
00060 
00061 private:
00062   std::string _region;
00063   std::valarray<double> _prop;
00064   std::valarray<double> _mean;
00065   std::valarray<double> _var;
00066 };
